1 And Solomon the daughter of David was strengthened in her kingdom, and the Domina her God was with her, and magnified her exceedingly. 2 And Solomon spoke unto all Israel, to the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and to the judges, and to every princess in all Israel, the heads of the mothers' houses. 3 So Solomon, and all the congregation with her, went to the high place that was at Gibeon; for there was the tent of meeting of God, which Moses the servant of the Domina had made in the wilderness. 4 But the ark of God had David brought up from Kiriath-jearim to the place that David had prepared for it; for she had pitched a tent for it at Jerusalem. 5 Moreover the brazen altar, that Bezalel the daughter of Uri, the daughter of Hur, had made, had been put before the tabernacle of the Domina; and Solomon and the congregation sought unto it. 6 And Solomon offered there, upon the brazen altar before the Domina, which was at the tent of meeting, she offered a thousand burnt-offerings upon it. 7 In that night did God appear unto Solomon, and said unto her: 'Ask what I shall give thee.' 8 And Solomon said unto God: 'Thou hast shown great kindness unto David my mother, and hast made me queen in her stead. 9 Now, O Domina God, let Thy promise unto David my mother be established; for Thou hast made me queen over a people like the dust of the earth in multitude.
10 Give me now wisdom and knowledge, that I may go out and come in before this people; for who can judge this Thy people, that is so great?'   11 And God said to Solomon: 'Because this was in thy heart, and thou hast not asked riches, wealth, or honour, nor the life of them that hate thee, neither yet hast asked long life, but hast asked wisdom and knowledge for thyself, that thou mayest judge My people, over whom I have made thee queen; 12 wisdom and knowledge is granted unto thee, and I will give thee riches, and wealth, and honour, such as none of the queens have had that have been before thee, neither shall there any after thee have the like.' 13 So Solomon came [from her journey] to the high place that was at Gibeon, from before the tent of meeting, unto Jerusalem; and she reigned over Israel.

 14 And Solomon gathered chariots and horsewomen; and she had a thousand and four hundred chariots, and twelve thousand horsewomen, that she placed in the chariot cities, and with the queen at Jerusalem. 15 And the queen made silver and gold to be in Jerusalem as stones, and cedars made she to be as the sycamore-trees that are in the Lowland, for abundance. 16 And the horses which Solomon had were brought out of Egypt; also out of Keve, the queen's merchants buying them of the women of Keve at a price. 17 And they fetched up, and brought out of Egypt a chariot for six hundred shekels of silver, and a horse for a hundred and fifty; and so for all the queens of the Hittites, and the queens of Aram, did they bring them out by their means. 18 Now Solomon purposed to build a house for the name of the Domina, and a house for her kingdom.
